main.name: Aritra Roy
main.bio: My name is Aritra. I'm studying M.Sc. Chemistry in Pondicherry University, one of the gretest Central University in India. I love studying reasearch articles and implementing those concepts in my work. Also, I love teaching, whether it is junior or fellow-student. My goal is to become a professor and to engage students in chemistry by relating as much as possible to everyday life through questioning and experiential way.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me to receive further details, get coached or anything else.

resume.skillmessage: I'm very much interested in theroatical research on various physical and chemical aspects of material science chemistry.

work.title: Team Member && React Specialist
work.description1: Have some knowledge of Spartan, Gaussian, GaussView and Cacao Software of Computational Chemistry.
work.description2: Studied about Basis Set, PES (Potential Energy Surface), Semi-emperical Method and DFT.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description1: Completed Java Programming under WB Govt. (Regd. No. - S/IL/47623) with Grade: B (80%-90%) on 20/12/2019.
work.description2: Completed C Programming under WB Govt. (Regd. No. - S/IL/47623) with Grade: B (80%-90%) on 20/12/2019.
work.description3: Completed Basic Course on Computer under WB Govt. (Regd. No. - S/IL/47623) with Grade: A (90%-100%) on 20/12/2019.
work.description4: Have the intermediate level knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript programming language.

Trends In Surface Science And Related Areas
International Seminar Under The Indo-Norwegian Cooperation Program

projects.title: Ni nanowire formation
projects.category: Ni Nanowire formation using a non-ionic surfactant and Hydrazine

projects.title: Fluorescent C Nps synthesis
projects.category: Blue, Green, Red and Yellow fluorescent C Nps synthesis using carbohydrates

testimonials.text: I realized it was like a dating agency: the ions are the lost souls looking for mates; the electrolyte is the agency that can help them find each other.
testimonials.user: Victoria Finlay, Jewels: A Secret History

testimonials.text: One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Two, never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it. Three, if you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
